Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கல்லா தவரின் கடையென்ப கற்றறிந்தும் நல்லா ரவையஞ்சு வார்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: They who, though they have learned and understood, are yet afraid of the assembly of the good, are said to be inferior (even) to the illiterate.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A symbolic ranking is shown. At the very bottom, in the lowest position, stands a scholar who is filled with knowledge (glowing mind) but is cowering in fear before a wise assembly ('கற்றறிந்தும் நல்லாரவை அஞ்சுவார்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On a step above this fearful scholar stands an unlearned person ('கல்லாதவர்'). The unlearned person is not as bright, but they are not cowering in fear, giving them a slightly higher, though still low, status.
Layered_Composition.Background: The assembly of the good ('நல்லாரவை') is depicted as a source of bright, intellectual light, which the fearful scholar is unable to face, thus proving their inferior status.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Those who have learned but fear to speak in a good assembly are considered even lower and more base than the unlearned.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The literal ranking on a set of steps, with the fearful scholar at the very bottom, is the central visual. This inversion of the expected hierarchy (learned above unlearned) makes the Kural's point powerfully.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Shameful, cowardly, ironic, a judgment of worth.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The assembly is the source of a bright, intimidating light. The fearful scholar is shown in a state of pathetic shadow, despite their inner knowledge.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A wide shot that clearly shows the hierarchical positions of the two figures in relation to the assembly.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: High-contrast lighting to emphasize the fear and the judgment.

Cultural_Anchors: The learned who fear the assembly ('கற்றறிந்தும் நல்லாரவை அஞ்சுவார்')
